word: But like the stars in the vast circuit of their appointed path, God\92s purposes know no haste and no delay. Through the symbols of the great darkness and the smoking furnace, God had revealed to Abraham the bondage of Israel in Egypt, and had declared that the time of their sojourning should be four hundred years. \93Afterward,\94 He said, \93shall they come out with great substance.\94 Genesis 15:14. Against that word, all the power of Pharaoh\92s proud empire battled in vain. On \93the self-same day\94 appointed in the divine promise, \93it came to pass, that all the hosts of the Lord went out from the land of Egypt.\94 Exodus 12:41. So in heaven\92s council the hour for the coming of Christ had been determined. When the great clock of time pointed to that hour, Jesus was born in Bethlehem.  The Desire of Ages, pp. 31, 32.2
